result.markdown:
--- title: "Dashboard_1" author: "Jiajun Zhang" date: "2023-11-06" categories: [code, analysis] image: "image.jpg" --- Data from datahub.io Including population figures for countries, regions (e.g. Asia) and the world. Data comes originally from World Bank and has been converted into standard CSV. Data

Load Package and Data

::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(broom) library(tidyverse) library(magrittr) pop_data <- read.csv("population_csv.csv") ``` :::

Show the world population by year

::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Filter the Data pop_all <- pop_data %>% filter(Country.Code == "WLD") #Visualize ggplot(pop_all, aes(x = Year, y = Value)) + geom_line() + theme_minimal() + labs(title = "World Population", x = "Year", y = "Population") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/world-population-1.png){width=672} ::: :::

Show the US population growth per year by percentage

::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Filter the Data pop_USA <- pop_data %>% filter(Country.Code == "USA")%>% mutate(percentage = c(0,(diff(Value) /head(Value, -1))*100)) #Visualize ggplot(pop_USA, aes(x = Year, y = percentage)) + geom_line() + theme_minimal() + labs(title = "World Population", x = "Year", y = "Population") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/USA-population-growth-1.png){width=672} ::: :::
